author: costin
msg: Request and Response are now interfaces.
Note that it is an "evolution" - i.e. the methods in the current interfaces
are based on what it is used in the current tomcat, not in what it should
be.
Please start reviewing the interfaces, and add documentation to the methods
that are right and remove the methods that are wrong ( fixing tomcat to use
the good methods ).
Also, added ContextInterceptor that will handle context initialization and
destruction.

author: rubys
msg: Make tomcat startup options common across Windows and Unix platforms.
Based on a feedback by Costin.
Submitted by: Conor MacNeill <conor@m64.com>

author: rubys
msg: Content type may be null!

author: rubys
msg: Per RFC2616, section 3.7 Media types:
media-type = type "/" subtype *( ";" parameter )
The type, subtype, and parameter attribute names are case-
insensitive.
Submitted by: Hirokatsu Hibino <nonki@orangesoft.co.jp>

author: costin
msg: Moved back to the original model of RequestDispatcher.
The most I could do is to document it and make it look
better (IMHO) - it is still the most difficult part of
tomcat ( and of the spec ).
Please - in case you want to start from scratch with
a new architecture, do start with RequestDispatcher and
an API where RD will fit - all the rest is trivial.
